overview:
David Rivington has over 20 years of global experience in fast moving technology businesses. He was Chief Operating Officer of Macropolitan Limited, a wireless wholesale broadband infrastructure provider, sold to Macquarie Wireless in 2007. Previously, he was a founder of Bulldog Communications where he held a number of senior roles including Chief Operating Officer, a role he retained for 12 months after exit. In both cases he led the exit transaction team of the selling company.

He spent 8 years at Apple Computer in a variety of senior roles in Paris and California, including Director of Product Planning for Apple Europe. He has worked as a researcher for Goldman Sachs and as a staff journalist for The Economist. He has an MBA from the London Business School and a degree in engineering from Queens University in Kingston Ontario Canada.
